name: Z saves the property of Y from fire. The circumstances indicate that Z intended to do so gratuitously. Under Section 70 of the Indian contract Act, 1872:
nameText: Z saves the property of Y from fire. The circumstances indicate that Z intended to do so gratuitously. Under Section 70 of the Indian contract Act, 1872:

options.name: Z is entitled to compensation from legal representative of Y
options.nameText: Z is entitled to compensation from legal representative of Y

options.name: Y is bound to give compensation to Z

options.name: Z is entitled to compensation from the local administration

options.name: Z is not entitled to compensation from Y.

name: Where consent to an agreement is caused by coercion, fraud or misrepresentation, the contract is ________
nameText: Where consent to an agreement is caused by coercion, fraud or misrepresentation, the contract is ________

Voidable at the option of the party, whose consent was so caused
options.nameText: Voidable at the option of the party, whose consent was so caused

options.name: Void ab initio
None of the above

name: Difference between contract of indemnity and contract of guarantee is
nameText: Difference between contract of indemnity and contract of guarantee is

options.name: That the former is a contract to save another from loss and the latter is a contract to perform the promise of a third person in case of his default.
options.nameText: That the former is a contract to save another from loss and the latter is a contract to perform the promise of a third person in case of his default.

options.name: That the former is a contract to discharge the liability of the third party while the latter is a contract to protect against loss.
options.nameText: That the former is a contract to discharge the liability of the third party while the latter is a contract to protect against loss.

options.name: That the former is a cover against the loss if the loss was caused by the promisor himself and not otherwise.
options.nameText: That the former is a cover against the loss if the loss was caused by the promisor himself and not otherwise.

options.name: That the latter should always be in writing while the former could be oral.
options.nameText: That the latter should always be in writing while the former could be oral.
